title: Oud
summary: The oud (Arabic: عود‎[1][2][3] ʿūd [ʕuːd]) (Somali: kaban or cuud) is a short-neck lute-type, pear-shaped, fretless stringed instrument[4] (a chordophone in the Hornbostel–Sachs classification of instruments), usually with 11 strings grouped in six courses, but some models have 5 or 7 courses, with 10 or 13 strings respectively.
